alert.note: Alert for O'Brien (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 23 at 6:24AM CDT until April 24 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT FOR CHEROKEE...SOUTHEASTERN PLYMOUTH...WESTERN BUENA VISTA AND SOUTHWESTERN O`BRIEN COUNTIES... At 624 AM CDT, a cluster of severe thunderstorms were located near Quimby, or 7 miles southwest of Cherokee, moving north at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Marcus and Cleghorn around 630 AM CDT. Larrabee around 640 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Meriden. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
